title: OSDM Offline Fare Delivery
description: OSDM extract of offline fare delivery

StationDetailsDef.description: Details of a station. Station names are not translated but provided in some cases in multiple character sets in case stations are named in local characters and additionally in latin characters. In some countries stations have multiple names depending on the countries local languages.

localCode.description: code unique with in the country only

stationCode.description: the code representing the station in the specified code-list

codes.description: The codes that can be used to represent the given station on the system. There can be several codes, in which case  it is relevant to have a list of couples.

StationDef.description: Used to represent a station location. This is a location that can be used as origin and destination for a train journey

code.description: the code representing the station in the specified code-list

StationCodeListDef.description: Code list used for the station codes: UIC = UIC codes as used by merits (UIC country code + local code) = Default/ UIC-R = UIC codes for reservation (UIC country code + local code reservation) / ERA = future ERA station code

ServiceBrandCodeDef.description: Service brand codes allowed in response, code list can be found on  [https:/uic.org/passenger/passenger-services-group/article/service-brand-code-list] (https:/uic.org/passenger/passenger-services-group/article/service-brand-code-list)

GeoCoordinate.description: Used to provide any geo-encoded location, regardless of environment, using longitude and latitude coordinates.

system.description:
geo coordinate system indication: 
 - WGS84 = WGS 84 standard system,
 - GRS80 = (outdated) GRS 80 coordinate system

latitude.description: Geographic coordinate that specifies the north-south position of a point on the earths surface

longitude.description: Geographic coordinate that specifies the east-west position of a point on the earths surface.

amount.description: by default of the scale the amount in cents

scale.description: scale of the amount - the number of positions after the comma

country.description: by default of the scale the amount in cents

amount.description: by default of the scale the amount in cents

scale.description: scale of the amount - the number of positions after the comma

cardValue.description: code of the card type according to code list

cardValueType.description: code list for the cardValue provided

cardName.description: card name for printing on fulfillments

issuer.description: RICS company code or the upcoming compatible ERA company code. In case proprietary codes are used on a bilateral base the codes must have at least 5 positions and start with x.

textRef.description: id of the text describing the class within the offline data text list

ComfortClassDef.description: Generic class classification, mostly used to harmonize choice and representation across multiple carriers

FulfillmentMediaTypeDef.description: Fulfillment types. RCT2, RCCST and UIC-PDF are official UIC standards.

FulfillmentOption.description: CIT paper implies printing on value paper which is stock controlled.

RegulatoryConditionsDef.description: general conditions applied to cover legal regulations within the area of validity. allocators must reflect these terms and conditions in the conditions of combined offers and indicate them to the customer where required. Which indications are mandatory to be shown to the customer will be defined in the SCICs CIV: terms and conditions according to COTIV regulation MD:  terms and conditions according to SMPS regulation EU-PRR: terms and conditions according to EU-PRR regulation

LegacyAccountingIdentifierDef.description: identifier of the fare in the current 301 accounting file

addId.description: sequential number of regional validities (leading positions in case the series is too short

tariffId.description: sequential number of the fares for one regional validity

id.description: \*** BULK-ONLY *** identification within the bulk data mandatory in bulk data exchange

dates.description: dates included in the calendar. In case no dates are provided the range is assumed to be valid

utcOffset.description: offset to UTC in minutes (number of minutes to be added to get UTC dates)

excludedTimeRange.description: time ranges excluded from the validity (e.g. off peak fulfillments)

from.description: minutes of the day in the time zone of travel

until.description: minutes of the day in the time zone of travel

numberOfTravelDays.description: number of allowed travel days (e.g. 3 travel days within 2 weeks)

returnConstraint.description: a return trip with the same carrier must be sold in combination

latestReturn.description: number of days after departure or start of validity of the last return

earliestReturn.description: number of days after departure or start of validity of the earliest return

excludedWeekdays.description: weekdays (ISO day of the week, 1 = Monday) between travel and return where travel is not allowed

TravelerTypeDef.description: Subset of the values from the traveler type code list IRS 90918-10

requiredCards.description: One of the listed cards is required to be valid at the time of travel.

CompanyDef.description: RICS company code or the upcoming compatible ERA company code. In case proprietary codes are used on a bilateral base the  codes must have at least 5 positions and start with x

model.description: Possible models are SEPARATE_CONTRACT, CLUSTERING, COMBINING.  The models need to be supported by the allocator.

combinableCarrier.description: List of all carriers where the model can be applied, in case the list is empty all combinations are allowed.

onlyWhenCombined.description: This combination model applies only in case the fare is combined with another carrier

referenceCluster.description: In case of CLUSTERING model: the cluster to which the fare belongs

allowedClusters.description: In case of CLUSTERING model: the other clusters that allow a combination

allowedAllocators.description: List of allowed allocators. If the list is empty all allocators with a sales contract are permitted.

allowedCommonContracts.description: List of carriers where a common contract with separate fulfillments are allowed.

timeUnit.description: Time unit in days, hours or minutes.

transactionType.description: code list Reason for after sale

feeRef.description: Reference to a price data item defining the fee; optional in case there is no fee but the  after sales transaction is allowed. Online services include fee directly in the fee tag.

applicationTimeStamp.description: absolute application time (UTC) in case of online services

carrierFee.description: indicates that the fee belongs to the carrier

individualContracts.description: indicates that the after sales of this fare can be treated independently per person.

items.description: One of the elements Zone, ViaStation, TrainLink, Line, or Polygon defining the regional validity

seqNb.description: order number of the list item

LineDef.description: terminalStation - in case the product requires a destination within the zone (e.g. local ticket  to go to the main rail station).  entryStation - Station to enter the zone in case the product requires to enter the zone via a  specific station (e.g. local zone ticket to start from the main rail station).

binaryLineId.description: Id to support local traffic standards (e.g. VDV,...).

nutsCode.description:
Nomenclature des units territoriales statistiques  
 COMMISSION REGULATION (EU) No 31/2011

travelDate.description: date and time of the departure where the train link starts

serviceBrand.description: restriction to a specific service brand

fareReferenceStationSet.description: reference to a list of stations included in the fare

ZoneDef.description: carrier - carrier responsible for the transport. entryStation - Station to enter the zone in case the product requires to enter the zone via a specific station (e.g. local zone ticket to start from the main rail station). terminalStation - Terminal station in case the product requires a destination within the zone (e.g. local ticket to go to the main rail station).

binaryZoneId.description: Id to support local traffic standards (e.g. VDV,...)

zoneIds.description: to be used in bar codes

nutsCode.description: Nomenclature des units territoriales statistiques COMMISSION REGULATION (EU) No 31/2011

acceptedBarCodes.description: for SiD fulfillment one of the listed bar codes is required

requiredBarCodes.description: One of the listed bar codes must be provided.

requiredSiS.description: To guarantee security in system (SiS) of the fulfillment one of the listed interfaces is required.

items.description: Interface type to ticket control data. REGISTRY means submitting the data to the central UIC registry. PEER_TO_PEER means data exchange is handled between the two parties directly.

individualTicketingPermitted.description: a separate fulfillment per traveler is permitted

separateTicketingRequired.description: a separate fulfillment for the regional constraint is required

BarCodeTypesDef.description: Item according to IRS 90918-9: FCB, TLB, SSB

crossBorder.description: the data are required only in case one of the cross border conditions apply

fulfillmentType.description: type of fulfillment in case the personal data are required for that type only

timeLimit.description: the change is limited to n hours after booking confirmation

ControlSecurityTypeDef.description: SIP: secure paper tickets; SID: security in data (signed bar code); SIS: security in system

LegacyReservationParameterDef.description: reservation parameter to support the UIC 90918-1 interface for booking

serviceLevelCode.description: service level code defined in UIC 90918-1

serviceCode.description: service code to be used in reservation

CarrierConstraintDef.description: Either excluded or included carriers can be set.

ServiceClassIdDef.description: Level of quality, finer grained than the comfort class.

combiningServiceClassIds.description: list of service class ids that can be combined with these service levels

textRef.description: id of the text describing the service level

includesClassName.description: indicates that the class name is included

ServiceLevelIdDef.description: Code of the service level, code-list in IRS 90918-1.

ServiceConstraintDef.description: Either excluded or included service brands can be set.

FareTypeDef.description: Basic UIC fare types used in 90918-10, 90918-4, and 90918-9.

RegionalConstraintDef.description: regional constraint of the fare-offline bulk data use the id of connection points whereas in an online environment the connection point is included

entryConnectionPointId.description: connection point connecting two fare regimes

exitConnectionPointId.description: connection point connecting two fare regimes

text.description: text without special characters according to ICAO specification

shortText.description: text without special characters according to ICAO specification

TextDef.description: directly included text in case of online services

text.description: text without special characters according to ICAO specification

shortText.description: text without special characters according to ICAO specification

ConnectionPointDef.description: connection point connecting two fare regimes. The connection is possible between stations of the two provided station sets.

afterSalesConditions.description: list of allowed after sales transactions and conditions

items.description: list of supported services (code list supported services)

stations.description: temporary option to include station details as long as MERITS can not provide them. Station codes must be those of merits

deliveryId.description: unique id of this data delivery

replacementDeliveryId.description: in case this delivery replaces an previous delivery

optionalDelivery.description: this delivery is not mandatory to be downloaded.

acceptedVersion.description: minimal version required to use these data

maxNumber.description: number of passengers allowed per accompanying passenger

minNumber.description: number of passengers required as accompanying passenger

number.description: Number of passengers that can be included with one passenger for free. The number is given in fractions. The  calculation needs a precision of 1 digit fraction (e.g. with 0.33 dogs you need 3 adults to transport one dog  for free).

maxWeightedPassengers.description: The total weighted number of passengers on the offer is restricted to be equal or smaller than this maximum

minWeightedPassengers.description: The total weighted number of passengers on the offer is restricted to equal or larger than this minimum

salesDatesRef.description: reference to the calendar woith valid sales dates

reservationOptions.description: options for reservations, Note: full details might be provided in the online version only

preferences.description: possible preferences to be requested in reservation without changing the fare

graficalReservation.description: grafical reservation is supported, interface type "NO","UIC_918",..

serviceBrands.description: service brands where the options apply

reservationRequiredForBrand.description: service brand mode for which a reservation is mandatory

reservationRequiredForMode.description: service service mode for which a reservation is mandatory

id.description: id of the card type within the issuer

includedCards.description: This card includes the listed cards

serviceClasses.description: list of service classes in case this class is available for different classes

cardIdRequired.description: the card id must be delivered in online sales

FareDef.description: single fare within a blk fare data delivery

id.description: unique id of the fare item to be included in accountings

fareDetailDescriptionRef.description: reference to a text with the details of the fare

legacyConversion.description: options for legacy conversion to 108.1: NO ( no conversion) YES (conversion allowed), ONLY (fare is provided only for conversion and should not be used otherwise

individualContracts.description: indicates that the fare can be treated independently per person although booked for more than one person.

FareReferenceStationSetDef.description: set of stations used in the fare equivalentely. E.g. Brussels-Region). The set is identified by the fare provicer and a code unique within the fare provider.

code.description: code of the fare reference station set used in regional validity. Unique within the fare provider.

legacyCode.description: id used in 108 as local station code

name.description: name to be used in route descriptions

CarrierLocations.description: locating the online resource via the carrier provided in the time table

TrainLocations.description: locating the online resource via the train from the time table

offerType.description: The resource provides offers bases on trains or based on areas. Train based offers must start and end at a real station and are not splitted inbetween a train run . Values TRAIN, AREA

system.description: system where the offer can be found (e.r. for TAP-TSI-B5 the reservation system code)

StationNamesDef.description: station names included temporarily until MERITS can provide the names

name.description: station name with upper and lower case letters in ASCII

nameUtf8.description: station name with upper and lower case letters in UTF8

shortName.description: station name with upper and lower case letters in ASCII

shortNameUtf8.description: station name with upper and lower case letters in UTF8

ZoneDefinitionDef.description: definition of a zone used to define regional validity. The area of the zone can be defined via a geo-poligone, a complte list of all contained stations or area codes from the NUTS code list. The carrier is eigther the carrier or transport authority responsible for the definition.
